block.p: LEAD: * Austin Rover Group Ltd., Coventry, England, said it had acquired the 51 percent interest in Austin Rover Cars of North America held by Norman Braman Enterprises, which, with the 49 percent previously held, gives it total ownership. Terms were not disclosed.

LEAD: * Austin Rover Group Ltd., Coventry, England, said it had acquired the 51 percent interest in Austin Rover Cars of North America held by Norman Braman Enterprises, which, with the 49 percent previously held, gives it total ownership. Terms were not disclosed.

* Austin Rover Group Ltd., Coventry, England, said it had acquired the 51 percent interest in Austin Rover Cars of North America held by Norman Braman Enterprises, which, with the 49 percent previously held, gives it total ownership. Terms were not disclosed.
* Campbell Soup Co., Camden, N.J., said it had acquired Industria Dolciaria Badia S.p.A., an Italian cake maker. Terms were not disclosed.

* Campbell Taggart Inc., Dallas, a subsidiary of Anheuser-Busch, said it was considering the sale of its Old American Potter Co. arts and crafts operation. Old America operates 25 stores in the South and Southwest and had sales of $30 million in 1986.

* Constar International Inc., Chattanooga, Tenn., said it had signed a letter of intent to sell its Bickford's Family Fare Resturant chain, which operates 34 resturants in New England, to Marriott Corp. Terms were not disclosed.
* Dow Chemical, Midland Mich., said that it would phase out use of halogenated chlorofluorocarbons in its products because the substance has been depleting the earth's ozone layer.
* Genentech, the biotechnology company, has had its earnings estimate cut by securities analysts because sales of the heart medicine T.P.A. may not be as strong as expected.

* Jewelcor Inc., Wilkes-Barre, Pa., said an investor group led by its president had extended its tender offer of $19 a share for the company to next Wednesday. The offer was to have expired yesterday.
* Lucky Stores, Dublin, Calif., said its board had changed the distribution date for Lucky's rights certificates to June 1 from May 13, as a result of the latest change in American Stores' offer.
* MHS Holdings Corp. said it had begun its tender offer for up to 11.4 million shares of Mohasco Corp. common stock, under a previously announced merger agreement.
* Moseley Holding Corp., Boston, said it had received written consents from holders of a majority of its common stock for a proposal to sell substantially all of the company's assets.

* Sherwood Group Inc. said it had completed the previously announced sale of the leases for 10 of its 33 retail offices and other related assets to Wolf Financial Group Inc.'s F. N. Wolf & Co. unit for $1.2 million.

* Southland Financial Corp., Irving, Texas, said it had received a proposal for a comprehensive restructuring of its debt and equity, under which two newly formed limited parnterships would acquire substantially all of the liabilities of the company.
* U S West Inc, Englewood, Colo., said its U S West Financial Services Inc. subsidiary had acquired 20.3 percent of Enhance's Securities Guaranty Inc. affiliate for about $50 million.
